text: The air thickens with the scent of iron and wild roses as the path narrows to a single winding trail. Vines hang like the tattered banners of a forgotten war, their thorns slick with fresh dew—or blood. Somewhere ahead, a low wind sighs through unseen briars, carrying with it the faint echo of bells that have not rung in centuries. All roads, it seems, have led you to this place, where the only way forward is to tear through the living veil of thorns.
lore: Legends speak of the Thornveil as the chapel’s first and last defense—a barrier woven by the will of the Thorn Matriarch herself. It is said the briars grow thicker with each soul that falls before her, feeding on their blood until the thorns themselves remember the shape of those they have slain.
